intro: Pedalium filiforme, commonly known as the slender pedalium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often arranged in cyathium structures, a typical feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and floral display.
